Keebles
An addictive physics-based vehicle building puzzle game. Build weird and wonderful vehicles using whatever you can find. Master rockets, balloons, parachutes and more. Save as many Keebles as you can, and be quick - the Whale at the End of the World won't wait forever.

About This Game

Build weird and wonderful vehicles using whatever you can find. Master rockets, balloons, parachutes and more. Save as many Keebles as you can, and be quick - the Whale at the End of the World won't wait forever!

Keebles challenges you to build vehicles to transport the fragile Bobble across 30 challenging levels, saving Keebles along the way.

Use the Workshop to design your vehicle. Different levels provide different items to make your vehicle from. Make use of various wheels, beams and gadgets to roll, slide, float and fly. The best design isn't always the most complicated, nor the most simple. Experiment and see what works best!

There are five stars to be earned for each level, plus a bonus Time Challenge award. Getting all of them isn't going to be easy, but it will be fun!
READ MORE

seph.au
5,679 products in account
603 reviews
Recommended
3.9 hrs on record
Posted: April 14
The world of Keebles is as challenging as it is beautiful. Don't let the 'cute and casual' appearance turn you away. Spread across 30 levels you are tasked with building vehicles to collect Keebles in a fragile glass bubble.
YouTube™ Video: Keebles Gameplay [PC HD] [60FPS] 
Views: 74
Keebles PC Gameplay [60FPS] http://store.steampowered.com/app/347040/ Subscribe for more Gameplay & Giveaways @ https://www.youtube.com/user/tr1ppa Focus on steam games, indies and early access.

Starting each level you are placed into workshop phase where you experiment with building vehicles. Given basic construction pieces with simple design logic initially, progression rewards both new items and more difficult obstructions to pass. Can happily say controls were both intuitive and user-friendly. Quite similar to Spore or World of Goo which another reviewer mentioned.

Objectives for 100% runs included, collecting 3 Keebles , using less pieces then required and beating a timer. These rewarded up to 5 stars per level, so for completionists this would take some time. While this does provide a challenge the fun really does lay in vehicle experimentation with the unlockable items, quite amazing what can be pulled off with some twitch skills. :)

Personally I enjoyed the visual style, clean vector based art with an upbeat snes era soundtrack. While Keebles doesn't bring anything new to the table it's a solid physics based puzzler that's hard to fault. If you liked similar games in the past (such as those mentioned above) I can recommend checking it out or shortlisting. Cheers.

Posted: March 27
Nice 'lil physics game. A mix of design and twitch skills are needed to get the most out of many levels... design iterations will only get you so far. Cute visuals obviously aren't everyone's thing, but don't underestimate Keebles - your soul may be slowly devoured as you work towards 5 stars on tricky levels, or strive to shave vital seconds off for the speed challenges.

Still, there's only 30 levels and you'll probably be left with enough soul to get by.

MartyrA2J
545 products in account
344 reviews
Recommended
3.0 hrs on record
Posted: March 27
Keebles is like a 2d Besieged. You build a contraption and overcome obstacles. With ten different parts that all bring something unique to the table. The true joy of Keebles lies in seeing your creation accomplish a goal or fail and explode in a horrific manner. Purposefully setting too many rockets on your machine; then watching it fly through the air and smash against the ground. Can be as satisfying, as completing a level. Sadly the game holds back these chaotic tendencies in favor of a more traditional mobile scheme. Collect stars(Keebles), beat speed goal. Etc. Nonetheless Keebles is fun, addictive and has plenty of replay value. With 31 levels to enjoy and master.
The game is extremely family friend and just about anyone can enjoy this title. I just wish it came with a level editor or an area to let me goof off and build whatever. Also the menus scream iOS/Andriod.

I made a video review to show off some of the features and gameplay of this game!
YouTube™ Video: IndieView - Keebles

HaRdNuT
60 products in account
1 review
Recommended
1.4 hrs on record
Posted: March 27


This review may not accurately reflect the state of the released version.">Pre-Release Review
Welcome to the world of Keebles; a fun and addictive physics-based puzzle game, Keebles you say? Yes, Keebles; these small but cute creatures need your help, and something to do with a whale! Need I say more?

The idea of the game is to create a vehicle that will carry your ‘Bobble’ around the level, upon touching a Keeble it will jump aboard your vehicle, taking them to safety at the end of each level and in return you’ll earn a Star rating out of 5. This rating will depend on how many Keebles you rescue, time taken to do so and parts used to build the vehicle.

Now onto the workshop where you begin to create your master plan to save all the Keebles, well at least try (thinking caps required). Design, alter, improve the 3 simple steps into saving them all. The workshop itself is very straight forward, within 10 minutes and a few clicks, you’ll be creating a whole bunch of creative vehicles to help save the Keebles. Now as the game is physics based, a lot of trial and error is needed but thankfully the game has zero loads times so switching between the levels, restarting or heading back to the Workshop is only a button press.

The game displays clean and nice looking graphics with a soundtrack that will keep you calm despite the occasional frustration, but thats the whole enjoyment of Keebles. You’ll look forward to seeing your vehicle move through the levels or fly in my case. Picking up new tools like parachutes, faster wheels and rockets as you progress, a new challenge is always ahead. It’s just down to your imagination to create the perfect vehicle to do the job.

So much fun is to be had with Keebles, you’ve just got to create it and let the good times roll.

Enjoy everyone!

- Blast Process

Posted: March 31
Keebles is a puzzle, wrapped in fuzzy, cute, anger!

From the intro song of this game until I wanted to smash my keyboard over the 5th level. (Thankfully given a little guidence from a friend) I enjoyed Keebles so damn much.

Seriously, the intro song is so damn catchy it should be the open of a cartoon.

In Keebles you must build a contraption with parts you are provided to problem solve, build, and trial and error your way to saving Keebles and making your way to the end of the level.

There are many ways to finish the level (much like an Angry Birds) however, your'e also racing against the clock and making sure no man is left behind. Although, a couple times I though about leaving one behind.

If you like interactive brain teasers than Keebles is a must buy, currently $7.99 It's a unique puzzle game hybrid.

Check out the first 5 levels here - (Video is still uploading I'm sure.)
